Row.Text: I am Cetshwayo kaMpande, king of the Zulu. I believe we can forge a powerful alliance, as long as you give us the respect we deserve.
I will be gracious in my defeat. Perhaps now there may be rest.
So war was unavoidable after all. Very well then, I shall not back down.
I believe both of our peoples have much to learn from each other. Would you like to make a public Declaration of Friendship?
You are a rank criminal, and I would be remiss not to warn the world of your wrongs. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
It has become clear that peace is no longer workable. Our conflicts must be settled with bloodshed.
Your expansion has come to threaten the rightful Zulu lands. If this continues, you may rest assured that I will take action.
I have no particular desire to engage in pleasantries with the enemy.
Well met. Please, come join me in the kraal.
Greetings. What business do you have today?
Be quick with it.
You are infringing upon our land and driving away our cattle. I urge you to stop; this is the only warning you will receive.
You have my attention.
Although I mourn the result of the war, I cannot regret making peace.
No friendship between nations is complete without commerce. Do you care to make a trade?
We cannot be reconciled. It is not worth the effort to bother.
It is clear that we both have important claims on this land, but our claims need not be wholly at odds. An Open Borders agreement could allow us both to benefit.
Do not take me for a fool.
I do not like to ask for help, but in these troubled times it is unavoidable.
I am king in my own country, and must be treated as such. I shall not bear this disrespect.
I do not wage war frivolously. If we are to meet in battle, we must see it through to the end.
I hope this has made you realize that the Zulu are not to be trifled with.
